page.title: 17HOUSING-GREENBELT-FARMLAND
page.content: THERE HAS BEEN LITTLE NEW BUILDING IN THE AREA SINCE 1950-60s;THE GLEBE IN LEIGH AND 5 HOUSES IN"THE STREET"IN BETCHWORTH.PROPERTY HAS BEEN IMPROVED. {SOME FARMS ARE NOW HOMES.}SOME LARGE HOUSES HAVE BEEN CONVERTED TO "HOMES" OTHERS BOUGHT BY INSTITUTIONS/COMPANY {THERE ARE 6 BIG HOUSES WITH PRIVATE {GROUNDS-}MORE PLACE(MrD.EVANS); WONHAM MANOR(ARAB OWNED);LEIGH PLACE with MOAT(Mr LANE); BURYS COURT(Major PETER WHITE RSigs, WHO WROTE AREA NOTES WITH THE PUPILS & Mr DONALD WHITE BAHons); OLD HOUSE and BETCHWORTH HOUSE(THE HON J. HAMILTON).{AREA IS GREENBELT, {PROTECTED AGAINST URBANISATION AND {AGRICULTURAL LAND DEVELOPMENT . {PLANNING PERMISSION NEEDED FOR {DEVELOPMENT.}DUE TO A STABLE COMMUNITY /EMPLOYMENT NEW HOUSES ARE NOT COMMON BUT IMPROVEMENTS/MODERNISATION GOING ON ALL THE TIME.{SOME PLANS IN OFFING
